Apple__Apple_scab.cause: Fungus Venturia inaequalis thriving in cool, wet conditions
Apple__Apple_scab.symptoms: Olive-green or brown spots on leaves and fruits leading to cracking and deformation
Apple__Apple_scab.treatment: Spray fungicides like mancozeb or captan; prune affected parts
Apple__Apple_scab.prevention: Use resistant varieties, remove fallen leaves, and ensure good air circulation

Apple_Black_rot.symptoms: Purple or brown leaf spots, fruit rot with concentric rings, branch dieback
Apple_Black_rot.treatment: Prune infected limbs, apply fungicides, and destroy infected fruit
Apple_Black_rot.prevention: Remove mummified fruits and maintain orchard sanitation

Apple_Cedar_apple_rust.cause: Fungus Gymnosporangium juniperi-virginianae spread from cedar trees
Apple_Cedar_apple_rust.symptoms: Yellow-orange leaf spots and fruit deformities
Apple_Cedar_apple_rust.treatment: Use fungicides like myclobutanil, and remove nearby cedar hosts
Apple_Cedar_apple_rust.prevention: Avoid planting apples near junipers, and apply fungicide sprays during spring

Banana leaf healthy.cause: No infection – indicates a healthy banana leaf
Banana leaf healthy.symptoms: Bright green color, smooth texture, no spots or wilting
Banana leaf healthy.prevention: Maintain proper watering, fertilization, and pest control

Banana Scab Moth.cause: Larvae of Nacoleia octasema feeding on fruit surfaces
Banana Scab Moth.symptoms: Scabby marks and blemishes on banana skins, especially near the crown
Banana Scab Moth.treatment: Use pheromone traps and insecticides; remove infested fruit
Banana Scab Moth.prevention: Bag banana bunches early and monitor for moth activity

Banana_Black Leaf Streak.symptoms: Dark streaks on leaves, yellowing, and premature leaf death reducing yield
Banana_Black Leaf Streak.treatment: Apply systemic fungicides and remove infected leaves
Banana_Black Leaf Streak.prevention: Plant resistant cultivars and ensure good field drainage

Banana_Black Sigatoka.cause: Fungus Mycosphaerella fijiensis spread by wind and rain
Banana_Black Sigatoka.symptoms: Dark brown streaks on leaves progressing to necrotic patches
Banana_Black Sigatoka.treatment: Use fungicides containing propiconazole or mancozeb
Banana_Black Sigatoka.prevention: Prune old leaves and avoid overcrowding for better air flow

Banana_Panama Disease.cause: Soil-borne fungus Fusarium oxysporum f.sp. cubense
Banana_Panama Disease.symptoms: Wilting, yellowing of older leaves, and vascular discoloration
Banana_Panama Disease.treatment: No chemical cure; remove infected plants and avoid replanting in infested soil
Banana_Panama Disease.prevention: Use resistant banana varieties and practice crop rotation

Banana_pestalotiopsis.cause: Fungus Pestalotiopsis microspora infecting weakened tissue
Banana_pestalotiopsis.symptoms: Small brown spots with yellow halos on leaves leading to necrosis
Banana_pestalotiopsis.treatment: Apply copper-based fungicides and improve field hygiene
Banana_pestalotiopsis.prevention: Avoid leaf injury and maintain balanced nutrition

Corn (maize)_healthy.cause: No infection – indicates a healthy maize plant
Corn (maize)_healthy.symptoms: Green leaves, upright growth, and no visible lesions or rust
Corn (maize)_healthy.prevention: Maintain proper crop spacing, irrigation, and nutrient balance

Corn(maize)Cercospora_leaf_spot Gray_lea.cause: Fungus Cercospora zeae-maydis thriving in warm, humid conditions
Corn(maize)Cercospora_leaf_spot Gray_lea.symptoms: Gray to tan rectangular lesions on leaves reducing photosynthesis
Corn(maize)Cercospora_leaf_spot Gray_lea.treatment: Apply fungicides like strobilurins or triazoles; rotate crops
Corn(maize)Cercospora_leaf_spot Gray_lea.prevention: Use resistant hybrids, and manage crop debris after harvest

Corn(maize)Common_rust.cause: Fungus Puccinia sorghi spread by windborne spores
Corn(maize)Common_rust.symptoms: Reddish-brown pustules on both sides of leaves
Corn(maize)Common_rust.treatment: Use resistant varieties; apply fungicides if severe
Corn(maize)Common_rust.prevention: Plant early to escape high infection periods and use rust-tolerant hybrids

Corn_(maize)Northern_Leaf_Blight.symptoms: Long, cigar-shaped gray lesions on leaves that may coalesce and kill tissue
Corn_(maize)Northern_Leaf_Blight.treatment: Use fungicides and remove infected residues
Corn_(maize)Northern_Leaf_Blight.prevention: Plant resistant hybrids and rotate with non-host crops

Grape_Black_rot.cause: Fungus Guignardia bidwellii spread by rain splash and wind
Grape_Black_rot.symptoms: Dark brown leaf spots with black edges, shriveled mummified berries
Grape_Black_rot.treatment: Spray fungicides like captan or myclobutanil; remove infected fruit
Grape_Black_rot.prevention: Prune regularly, destroy mummified berries, and maintain vineyard sanitation

Grape_Esca(Black_Measles).cause: Complex of fungi including Phaeomoniella chlamydospora and Phaeoacremonium aleophilum
Grape_Esca(Black_Measles).symptoms: Tiger-stripe leaf pattern, dark streaks in wood, and berry shriveling
Grape_Esca(Black_Measles).treatment: Prune infected vines below diseased wood and apply fungicidal trunk sprays
Grape_Esca(Black_Measles).prevention: Avoid pruning during wet weather and disinfect pruning tools

Grape__Leaf_blight(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spot).symptoms: Small angular brown spots that enlarge and cause premature leaf fall
Grape__Leaf_blight(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spot).treatment: Spray with copper-based fungicides or mancozeb
Grape__Leaf_blight(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spot).prevention: Ensure good air circulation and avoid overhead irrigation

Hibiscus_Healthy_Leaf.cause: No infection – indicates a healthy hibiscus leaf
Hibiscus_Healthy_Leaf.symptoms: Glossy green leaves with no yellowing, spotting, or curling
Hibiscus_Healthy_Leaf.prevention: Maintain proper sunlight, watering, and soil nutrition

Hibiscus_Leaf Scorch or Drought Stress.cause: Lack of water or extreme heat causing tissue dehydration
Hibiscus_Leaf Scorch or Drought Stress.symptoms: Brown edges, curling, and dry brittle leaves
Hibiscus_Leaf Scorch or Drought Stress.treatment: Increase watering frequency and provide shade during hot hours
Hibiscus_Leaf Scorch or Drought Stress.prevention: Mulch soil and maintain consistent watering schedule

Hibiscus_Nitrogen Deficiency.symptoms: Yellowing of older leaves and stunted growth
Hibiscus_Nitrogen Deficiency.treatment: Apply nitrogen-rich fertilizer such as urea or composted manure
Hibiscus_Nitrogen Deficiency.prevention: Conduct regular soil testing and maintain balanced fertilization

Hibiscus_Watering Issues and Environment.cause: Overwatering, underwatering, or rapid environmental changes
Hibiscus_Watering Issues and Environment.symptoms: Leaf drop, yellowing, or wilting despite healthy roots
Hibiscus_Watering Issues and Environment.treatment: Adjust watering habits and ensure proper soil drainage
Hibiscus_Watering Issues and Environment.prevention: Use well-draining soil and protect from sudden temperature shifts

Potato__Early_blight.cause: Fungus Alternaria solani thriving in warm, humid weather
Potato__Early_blight.symptoms: Dark concentric spots on lower leaves leading to leaf drop and reduced yield
Potato__Early_blight.treatment: Apply fungicides like chlorothalonil or mancozeb and remove infected debris
Potato__Early_blight.prevention: Use resistant varieties, rotate crops, and avoid overhead irrigation

Potato_Late_blight.cause: Pathogen Phytophthora infestans spread by wind and rain
Potato_Late_blight.symptoms: Water-soaked lesions on leaves, white mold on undersides, and tuber rot
Potato_Late_blight.treatment: Spray systemic fungicides such as metalaxyl or copper oxychloride
Potato_Late_blight.prevention: Plant certified disease-free seed and destroy cull piles

Rose_Rust.symptoms: Orange or rust-colored pustules on leaf undersides causing defoliation
Rose_Rust.treatment: Remove infected leaves and apply sulfur or copper-based fungicides
Rose_Rust.prevention: Ensure good air circulation and avoid overhead watering

Rose_healthy.cause: No infection – indicates a healthy rose plant
Rose_healthy.symptoms: Dark green leaves, firm stems, and healthy blooming flowers
Rose_healthy.prevention: Provide adequate sunlight, nutrients, and pest management

Rose_sawfly_Rose_slug.cause: Larvae of sawflies feeding on leaf surfaces
Rose_sawfly_Rose_slug.symptoms: Skeletonized leaves appearing transparent or windowed
Rose_sawfly_Rose_slug.treatment: Spray insecticidal soap or neem oil; handpick larvae if few
Rose_sawfly_Rose_slug.prevention: Inspect leaves regularly and encourage natural predators like ladybugs

Tomato Insect Damage.cause: Feeding by insects such as caterpillars, aphids, or whiteflies
Tomato Insect Damage.symptoms: Chewed leaves, holes in fruit, and distorted new growth
Tomato Insect Damage.treatment: Use insecticidal soap, neem oil, or biological control agents
Tomato Insect Damage.prevention: Monitor regularly and use pest-resistant tomato varieties

Tomato Leaf Miner.cause: Larvae of Tuta absoluta burrowing into leaves
Tomato Leaf Miner.symptoms: White serpentine mines on leaves leading to drying and death
Tomato Leaf Miner.treatment: Apply neem-based insecticides or pheromone traps
Tomato Leaf Miner.prevention: Remove infested leaves and use insect-proof nets

Tomato healthy.cause: No infection – indicates a healthy tomato plant
Tomato healthy.symptoms: Green upright leaves, firm stems, and healthy fruit set
Tomato healthy.prevention: Provide balanced fertilizer, proper sunlight, and pest management

Tomato_Bacterial_spot.symptoms: Small dark spots on leaves and fruits that enlarge and scab
Tomato_Bacterial_spot.treatment: Apply copper-based bactericides and remove infected tissue
Tomato_Bacterial_spot.prevention: Use certified seed and avoid working in wet fields

Tomato_Early_blight.symptoms: Dark concentric rings on older leaves and premature leaf drop
Tomato_Early_blight.treatment: Spray fungicides like mancozeb or chlorothalonil
Tomato_Early_blight.prevention: Rotate crops and maintain good field sanitation

Tomato_Late_blight.symptoms: Water-soaked leaf lesions with white mold underneath, fruit rot
Tomato_Late_blight.treatment: Use fungicides like copper oxychloride or metalaxyl
Tomato_Late_blight.prevention: Destroy infected debris and avoid overhead irrigation

Tomato_Leaf_Mold.cause: Fungus Passalora fulva thriving in high humidity
Tomato_Leaf_Mold.symptoms: Yellow spots on upper leaf surfaces and olive-green mold underneath
Tomato_Leaf_Mold.treatment: Improve ventilation and apply fungicides like chlorothalonil
Tomato_Leaf_Mold.prevention: Avoid overcrowding and water plants at soil level

Tomato_Septoria_leaf_spot.symptoms: Small circular leaf spots with dark borders and gray centers
Tomato_Septoria_leaf_spot.treatment: Remove infected leaves and use copper-based fungicides
Tomato_Septoria_leaf_spot.prevention: Rotate crops and avoid wetting foliage

Tomato_Spider_mites Two-spotted_spider_m.symptoms: Yellow speckling, webbing on undersides, and leaf drying
Tomato_Spider_mites Two-spotted_spider_m.treatment: Spray miticides or neem oil; increase humidity
Tomato_Spider_mites Two-spotted_spider_m.prevention: Avoid dry dusty conditions and monitor regularly

Tomato_Target_Spot.symptoms: Circular leaf spots with dark concentric rings resembling targets
Tomato_Target_Spot.treatment: Apply fungicides and remove lower infected leaves
Tomato_Target_Spot.prevention: Ensure good air circulation and avoid water splash

Tomato_Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.symptoms: Upward curling and yellowing of leaves, stunted growth
Tomato_Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.treatment: Remove infected plants and control whiteflies with insecticides
Tomato_Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.prevention: Use virus-free seeds and resistant varieties

Tomato__Tomato_mosaic_virus.cause: Tobamovirus spread by mechanical contact or contaminated tools
Tomato__Tomato_mosaic_virus.symptoms: Mottled, mosaic-like leaves with deformation and reduced yield
Tomato__Tomato_mosaic_virus.treatment: Remove infected plants and disinfect tools
Tomato__Tomato_mosaic_virus.prevention: Use resistant varieties and avoid handling when plants are wet

apple_healthy.cause: No infection – indicates a healthy apple tree
apple_healthy.symptoms: Green, glossy leaves and well-formed, spot-free fruits
apple_healthy.prevention: Ensure balanced nutrition, proper pruning, and pest management

grapes_healthy.cause: No infection – indicates a healthy grapevine
grapes_healthy.symptoms: Bright green leaves, firm stems, and clean fruit clusters
grapes_healthy.prevention: Maintain good vineyard hygiene and proper irrigation

potato_healthy.cause: No infection – indicates a healthy potato plant
potato_healthy.symptoms: Green upright foliage and well-developed tubers without spots or rot
potato_healthy.prevention: Use certified seed potatoes and maintain disease-free soil
